alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Montour; Northumberland; Schuylkill; Union (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 06 at 2:47PM EST until March 07 at 5:00AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 AM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches with the lower amounts in the valleys and higher amounts on the ridges. * WHERE...Union, Montour, Northumberland, Columbia and Schuylkill Counties. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 5 AM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel may be diffcult overnight. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The precipitation will likely be rain this evening, but mix with and change to snow. The change will happen on the ridges first, then lower into the valleys. The heaviest snowfall will be between 9 PM and 3 AM. Snowfall rates of one inch per hour are possible. The snow will be wet, with a high water content.
info.instruction: The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission remind motorists to adjust speeds based on driving conditions as winter weather impacts will include snow covered roads and limited visibility. Call 5 1 1 or visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway and traffic conditions. To report snow or ice, post to the NWS State College Facebook page, use Twitter @NWSStateCollege, or visit weather.gov/ctp.
